meanings.definition: The quality of being unconventional or slightly strange in behavior or appearance.
meanings.sent1: Her eccentricity shone through in her unique fashion sense.
meanings.sent2: His eccentricity made him stand out in a crowd.
meanings.sent3: Despite his eccentricity, he was always kind and friendly.
meanings.sent4: Her eccentricity was like a colorful painting in a room of black and white.
meanings.sent5: The town never forgot the eccentricity of the old man who danced in the rain.

meanings.definition: The distance between the center and a point on a conic section, such as an ellipse or hyperbola.
meanings.sent1: The eccentricity of the ellipse determined its shape.
meanings.sent2: The astronomer calculated the eccentricity of the planet's orbit.
meanings.sent3: The eccentricity of the hyperbola puzzled the students in math class.
meanings.sent4: The eccentricity of the orbit was like a rollercoaster ride through space.
meanings.sent5: The eccentricity of the comet's path was a marvel to behold.
